choice_experiment.title: Choice Experiment
choice_experiment.instruction_text: Not every patient can be treated in a medical emergency. A decision has to be made about which patient to treat. Which of the patients shown below should be treated?
choice_experiment.doctor_instruction: Move the physician to the patient to be treated!
choice_experiment.reconsider_message: A data-driven computer model suggests treating the other patient!
choice_experiment.decision_text: Would you like to change your decision?
choice_experiment.final_selection_instruction: Now please make your final selection for which patient to treat.

group_preferences.general_health_question: How would you rate your general health?
group_preferences.illness_question: Have you been severely ill in the last year?
group_preferences.children_question: Do you have children or are you planning to have children?

instructions.title: Thank you very much! In the following we would like to ask you a few more general questions.

intro.intro_title: How would you decide when confronted with critical life-and-death decisions?
intro.intro_paragraph_1: Your view on this question is highly valuable. We greatly appreciate your willingness to participate in this survey on medical decision-making.
intro.intro_paragraph_2: Your participation is voluntary, and your information will be collected anonymously, in accordance with data protection regulations. Please read all instructions and questions carefully and answer honestly.

intro.consent_message: Please decide now if you want to give your consent to the use of your answers for scientific purposes. If you do not agree, you will be redirected to the end of the survey.
intro.yes_label: I consent to the use of my data submitted as part of this questionnaire for research purposes.
intro.no_label: I do not consent to the use of my data submitted as part of this questionnaire for research purposes.

no_consent.no_consent_message: Since you did not consent to participate in the survey, your responses were not recorded. We appreciate your time.

procedural_ratings.rating_intro: Not every patient can be treated in a medical emergency. There are procedures that can be used to determine which patients should be treated in such situations. In the following, please indicate how morally fair you find these procedures.
procedural_ratings.scale_indicator: Please rate on a scale from 1 to 6:
procedural_ratings.rating_save_life_years: Treating patients who will gain the most life years
procedural_ratings.rating_benefit_future: Treating patients who will benefit others in the future
procedural_ratings.rating_treatment_success: Treating patients with the highest chance of treatment success
procedural_ratings.rating_treatment_effort: Prioritizing patients requiring the least treatment effort
procedural_ratings.rating_medication_effect: Selecting patients for whom medication is most effective

questions.label: Save the most life years
questions.full_text: Save the most life years: prioritize those who have the most life years left after overcoming the disease; i.e., treat younger patients first.

questions.label: Provide advantage to the disadvantaged
questions.full_text: Provide advantage to the disadvantaged: prioritize those who are worse off than others; i.e., treat sickest patients first.

questions.label: Benefit to others in the future
questions.full_text: Benefit to others in the future: Prioritize those who are likely to make relevant contributions to the benefit of others; i.e., treat patients who have children or are planning to have children.

questions.label: First-come, first-served
questions.full_text: First-come, first-served: Prioritize those who were first in line; i.e., treat patients who arrived first at the hospital.

questions.label: Maximize treatment success
questions.full_text: Maximize treatment success: Prioritize those with the highest probability of survival after treatment; i.e., treat patients with the highest chance of recovery.

questions.label: Minimize treatment effort
questions.full_text: Minimize treatment effort: Prioritize those who will be cured with minimum effort; i.e., treat patients who need the least medication.

questions.label: Maximize the medication effect
questions.full_text: Maximize the medication effect: Prioritize those where the improvement per medication is highest; i.e., treat patients who benefit most from a given medication.

questions.label: Random selection
questions.full_text: Random selection: Treatment should be allocated by random lottery; i.e., individual characteristics should not be considered.

thank_you.thank_you_title: Thank you for submitting your survey!
thank_you.thank_you_message: Your responses have been recorded. We appreciate your time and effort in helping us with this research.
